snippet: The police said officers found a chilling scene as the suspect, who is facing attempted murder charges in another case, tried to flee wearing blood-soaked clothes and plastic bags on his hands.
abstract: New York City police say Daniel Romain of Brooklyn stabbed his girlfriend Tisa Kelly to death, even as police officers were en route to East Flatbush home for domestic disturbance call; Romain is charged with second-degree murder.

byline.contributor: Sarah Maslin Nir and Liam Stack contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The police said officers found a chilling scene as the suspect, who is facing attempted murder charges in another case, tried to flee wearing blood-soaked clothes and plastic bags on his hands.

headline.main: Brooklyn Man Fatally Stabbed Girlfriend as Police Were on Their Way, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Man Is Accused of Fatally Stabbing His Girlfriend
